title: A World of Malaz RPG - TriStat d8
description:
I have converted Tri-Stat d8 to enable a GM who is familiar with the books and world to run a game in it. It is in no way complete and exhaustive. Most of the context and details of Erikson/EsslemontÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s world is missing.

If your players are unfamiliar with the world, itÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s up to you to familiarise them with it enough to play. Give them a bit of an overview. Explain the geography, the politics, the history, the magical lore, the religion. If possible, cajole them into reading some of the books themselves. IÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢m led to believe that thereÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s actually a Role Playing Game in the works for the Malazan universe. Why Tri-Stat? Because somewhere I read that was what theyÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢re planning to use for the official Malazan RPG. Correct or incorrect, by the time IÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢d familiarised myself with this system I couldnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t be bothered to learn another one.

Why d8? Because d6 is designed for human games, and the World of Malaz has plenty of other races that, in at least one way, are just better than humans. It also makes it easier to encompass ascended beings.

Do you disagree with how IÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ve done something? Great. Change it. IÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ll be the first to admit that this is a bit of a bodge job. Just do what you must to make it work.

What are aspects? IÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ve stolen them from the Fate system; specifically the Dresden Files incarnation of Fate RPG. Why? Because I love the way character creation for the Dresden Files leaves you with a strong impression of who your character is. I also love how the aspects reward and encourage you to play in character. Yeah, IÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ve pretty much grafted them on, but I plan to make it work. Lastly, this isnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t meant to entirely replace the TriStat dX core book. In fact, IÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢d actively encourage you to have it to hand.
